sentences.sContent: ...memories of her father's complete abandonment of her.
sentences.sCn: …她父亲对她的彻底抛弃的那些记忆。

words.tran: 被抛弃的；无约束的；恣意放荡的；寡廉鲜耻的
抛弃（abandon的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: The abandonment of a place, thing, or person is the act of leaving it permanently or for a long time, especially when you should not do so

sentences.sContent: Both were big at birth but were not abnormally large.
sentences.sContent_eng: Both were big at birth but were not abnormally large.
sentences.sCn: 这两个孩子出生时都比较大，但并非异常的大。

sentences.sContent: This way, if the function or procedure crashes or terminates abnormally, it will not affect any of the other instance processes.
sentences.sContent_eng: This way, if the function or procedure crashes or terminates abnormally, it will not affect any of the other instance processes.
sentences.sCn: 这样，如果该函数或过程崩溃或者异常终止，也不会对其他实例进程产生任何影响。

sentences.sContent: People with the condition have red blood cells smaller than normal — causing a mild form of anaemia — but abnormally high levels of them.
sentences.sContent_eng: People with the condition have red blood cells smaller than normal — causing a mild form of anaemia — but abnormally high levels of them.
sentences.sCn: 患有这种病的人的红细胞比正常人的更小——这导致了一种轻微的贫血——但是红细胞水平异常地高。

synos.tran: 反常地；变态地；不规则地

words.tran: 反常的，不规则的；变态的

sentences.sContent: ‘Do you let your kids travel alone at night?’ ‘Absolutely not!’
sentences.sCn: “你会让孩子们晚上单独外出吗？”“当然不行！”

sentences.sContent: ...which does absolutely nothing for the climate...
...there's no disputing that every child is different--and some will absolutely do better with less...

trans.tranOther: used when you strongly disagree with someone or when you do not want someone to do something
